Eyewitness account: The claim was verified through the eyewitness account of a man who was using the ATM machine outside the bank and saw the raccoons inside the building.
Photographs: Photographs taken at the scene showed the raccoons moving around the bank, knocking over objects, and sitting behind a desk, providing visual evidence of their presence.
Physical evidence: The trail of muddy pawprints leading to the conclusion that the raccoons climbed an outside tree, crawled through the air ducts, and fell through the ceiling tiles provided physical evidence of their entry into the bank.
Expert statement: The Communications Manager of the Peninsula Humane Society and Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (PHS/SPCA) confirmed the incident, stating that raccoons are known for their intelligence and ability to access various places.
